result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CASES: 22CF60 & 22CF200. 10:41 AM Defendant Melissa Mast Borchardt in court.  Attorney Donna Burger in court for Melissa Mast Borchardt.  Attorney David Stilin in court for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. 
22CF60: CT gives ruling on def's motion. CT finds def did not meet burden, motion denied. 
Atty Burger- requesting JT.  All motions in limine, witness lists and proposed jury instructions must be filed at least 30 days prior to Final PreTrial.  Dispositive Motions must be filed at least 60 days prior to Final PreTrial and obtain a hearing date from the judicial assistant prior to filing. Bond cont. 10:54 am adj.

11:00 AM Defendant Melissa Mast Borchardt in court.  Attorney Donna Burger in court for Melissa Mast Borchardt.  Attorney David Stilin in court for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. Counsel advised court that def wishes to waive PH. CT questions def. CT accepts waiver of PH. CT finds PC, def bound over. Information to be filed. ADA indicates the charges mirror the charges in complaint. Atty Burger preserved for 15 days. Atty Burger- waives reading. NG pleas entered. Bond cont. 11:03 am adj.

10:19 AM Defendant Melissa Mast Borchardt in court. Attorney Donna Burger in court for Melissa Mast Borchardt.  Attorney David Stilin in court for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. 
Motion Hearing in 22CF60, STC in 22CF200: CT quashes warrant previously authorized. 
22CF60: ADA calls officer Traczyk- S&T. Atty Burger cross. Atty Burger- argument. ADA- argument. CT- counsel to schedule oral ruling with JA. Bond cont. 10:46 am adj.
Status conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary Hearing scheduling for July 27, 2022 at 2:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
